ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: People avoid asking me for favors or help.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People think I am exaggerating my symptoms.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People keep their distance from me.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People assume my behavior is due to my mental health problem.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People think I should keep my mental health problem a secret.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People blame me for not getting better.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People have low expectations of me.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People think my mental health problem is my fault.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People treat me as less than others.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People think that I'm weak for having a mental health problem.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: People think my mental health problem is not serious.
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very often

ElementDescription: Microaggressions sum score (sum of all items)
Notes: Sum calculated if at least 10 items present

ElementDescription: Microaggressions average score (mean of all items)
Notes: Average calculated if at least 10 items present
